page.title: 07WINCANTON SUMMER NEWS 1985
page.content: Wincanton Transport Group celebrated its{diamond jubilee}at Aldermeads. Attractions included vintage cars, buses & lorries, wellie throwing,fire- jugglers and stalls.A successful{horse {show}was held at Hatherleigh Farm. Several events were organised for charity. A{Ben Hur}day, consisting of human chariot races, raised Â£200. The Monmouth Muster, typical of the {Somerset Pitchfork Rebellion celebrations raised Â£250.A fancy dress cricket match was played between the Orange Girls and the Rebels. Two local pubs broke the bottles in which they'd collected money for Higher View old people's home and the Scouts. { Vandals}damaged a shelter in the recreation ground.{Dogs}had fouled the play area, but dog training classes started at the Youth centre. {Buses on survey dont all run every day
